location.name: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

title: Flight Operations Technical Publications Specialist
content:
Working at Breeze Airways is an exciting endeavor and a serious commitment to bring “The World’s Nicest Airline” to life. We work cross-functionally with truly awesome Team Members to deliver on our mission: “To make the world of travel simple, affordable, and convenient. Improving our guests travel experience using technology, ingenuity and kindness.”Breeze is hiring- join us!
The Flight Operations Technical Publications Specialist is responsible for the currency and compliance of company manuals and publications. This position reports to the Director of Flight Training and Standards and works concurrently with the Manager Publications and Operations Excellence and supports manual control, distribution, and tracking for the various departments and operations groups.  This position requires strong communication across all areas of Flight Operations, with strong grammar and editing abilities with attention to detail. 
Here’s what you’ll do

Maintain and update the master file of Flight Operations company manuals, forms, and documents in the Company Manual System.
Manage the currency, control, distribution, and tracking of Flight Operations Company manuals and publications
Create draft documents and coordinate revisions with manual owners
Create, formats, and edits various company forms as necessary.
Tracking and recording revision transmittal documents from assigned manual holders
Issues and distributes bulletins to company manuals as required
Updates and distributes manuals/documents to web, mobile devices, synced servers and Electronic Flight bag (EFB)
Verify compliance with published procedures to identify any inconsistencies as deemed necessary per the Technical Style Guide (TSG).
Serves as subject matter expert for creating, editing, and publishing manuals and documents.
Review the impact of procedural changes to the manual content and amend the procedure(s) and/or process(es) as deemed necessary.
Upon receipt of a revision or new (original) manual, ensure the revision has been accepted and/or approved, as applicable
Partners with subject matter experts (SMEs), IT and stakeholders in department and cross functional projects.
Provides end user support for manuals on web and mobile devices
Multitask different work activities and shifting attention from one task to another, while meeting the demands of several different stakeholders
Have a working knowledge and understanding of applicable CFRs and associated regulatory/governmental regulations.
Supports the Company read and sign program.
Maintain established best practices, identify and champion process improvements

Here’s what you need to be successful
Minimum Qualifications

Must be at least 18 years of age
High School diploma or equivalent educational achievement
Two years of experience working in a publications environment, or writing technical documentation
Should have a detailed understanding of the format, layout, publishing and distribution process of electronic documents
Strong skills in the following programs - Microsoft Office 365 tools including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Adobe Reader Acrobat Professional
Effective verbal, written and listening communication skills
Must read, write, and speak English fluently
Must have authorization to work in the US as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986
Must be flexible and willing to work days, nights, weekends, holidays, and overtime if needed
Must be willing to work with other departments within the company as needed
Achieve performance measures and adhere to established standards in conjunction with Breeze Aviation Group Values of Safety, Kindness, Integrity, Ingenuity and Excellence

 
Preferred Qualifications

Aviation experience preferred
Experience with publications software
HTML / XML, style sheets, structured authoring or content management systems experience preferred
Background in aviation with emphasis on Part 121 Air Carrier Operations, Training, and Management

 
Skills/Talents

Skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written
Strong presentation skills with the ability to communicate to Leadership
Must be able to handle high stress situations
Ability to work with fellow Team Members with a variety of personalities
Ability to multi-task easily
Must be fluent in English

Perks of the Job

Health, Vision and Dental
Health Savings Account with Breeze Employee Match
401K with Breeze Employee Match
PTO
Travel on Breeze and other Airlines too!
Breeze Airways provides equal employment opportunities to all Team Members and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Breeze Airways will never request your Social Security Number, Driver’s License or Date of Birth on our job postings. Job Postings requesting any or all of this information should be regarded as a scam. To ensure you are applying to an actual Breeze Airways posting, please apply online at www.flybreeze.com  then click “Careers” at the bottom of the page.
